content.heading: HTML Encoding (Character Sets)
paragraphs: To display an HTML page correctly, a web browser must know which character set to use.

content.heading: The HTML charset Attribute
paragraphs: The character set is specified in the <meta> tag.

content.heading: The ASCII Character Set
paragraphs: ASCII was the first character encoding standard for the web, defining 128 characters including English letters (A-Z), numbers (0-9), and special characters.

content.heading: The ANSI Character Set
paragraphs: ANSI (Windows-1252) is the original Windows character set, identical to ASCII for the first 127 characters and includes special characters from 128 to 159.

content.heading: The ISO-8859-1 Character Set
paragraphs: ISO-8859-1 was the default character set for HTML 4, supporting 256 character codes and identical to ASCII for the first 127 characters.

content.heading: The UTF-8 Character Set
paragraphs: UTF-8 is identical to ASCII for values 0 to 127 and continues up to 10,000 characters, covering almost all characters and symbols.
